required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retinal Neurodegenerative and Vascular Changes in Diabetic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Retinal Neurodegenerative and Vascular Changes in Diabetic Patients: an OCT-based Comparative Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Iuliu Hatieganu University of Medicine and Pharmacy

clinical_study.source: Iuliu Hatieganu University of Medicine and Pharmacy

brief_summary.textblock: Using Optical Coherence Tomography and ImageJ software the investigators will analyze retinal and choroidal vascular changes and their impact on retinal layers among patients with diabetes without retinopathy and patients with diabetes and retinopathy.

detailed_description.textblock: Relieving the burden of diabetic retinopathy treatment require a prompt and non-invasive assessment of diabetic patients before the occurence of diabetic retinopathy. Since OCT is capable of imaging retina with such a high precision, retinal changes occuring before any clinical signs of retinopathy, such as microaneurysm or haemorrhages, can now be assessed. In the present study the investigators are analyzing the connection between retinal arteries and veins regarding lumen diameter, vessel wall thickness and their correlation with retinal nerve fiber layer and ganglion cell layer thickness. Moreover, using binarization of the choroid the investigators will assess its relationship with outer retina layers, such as retinal pigment epithelium and photoreceptors.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between choroid and outer retina using SD-OCT- based binarization technique
primary_outcome.description: starting from EDI-OCT scans the investigators will analyze choroidal parameters such as Luminal area, Stromal area, Total choroidal area, Chorodial vascularity index and correlate them with retinal pigment epithelium (RPE),outer nuclear layer(ONL) and photoreceptors' thickness (PR)

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between neurodegeneration and retinal vessels characteristics
primary_outcome.description: using full width at half maximum method, the investigators will measure peripapillary arteries and veins' diameters, their wall thickness and correlate them with RNFL and ganglion cell layer(GCL) thickness

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between choroidal parameters and their influence on Best corrected visual acuity(BCVA)
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will analyze if changes in the choroid will influence patients' visual acuity. For statistical reasons, visual acuity will be converted to logMAR(logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between renal function and choroidal parameters
secondary_outcome.description: Using estimated glomerular filtration rate(eGFR-mL/min/1.73 m2) the investigators will analyze if a decreased eGFR will produce changes in choroidal architecture

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between sistemic factors and choroidal parameters
secondary_outcome.description: The investigators will document if the presence of High Blood pressure(yes/no) and current smoking(yes/no) influences choroidal thickness or CVI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between choroidal parameters and diabetes control
secondary_outcome.description: Using HbA1c(Glycated haemoglobin) the investigators will analyze the choroidal's behaviour under different HbA1c levels.

intervention.description: Spectral Domain Optical Coherence Tomography(SD-OCT) examination will be performed for every patient: posterior pole scan, EDI-OCT(enhanced depth imaging-OCT) and peripapillary RNFL(retinal nerve fiber layer)

study_pop.textblock: All participants were recruited between July 2018 and July 2019 at Department of Ophthalmology, Emergency County Hospital Cluj, Romania. Healthy subjects were recruited from patients scheduled for routine ocular examination at Department of Ophthalmology, Emergency County Hospital Cluj, Romania

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- history of type 1DM for more than 1 year
- history of type 2 DM for more than 3 months
- diagnosis of no DR or mild Non-proliferative diabetic retinopathy(NPDR)
Exclusion Criteria:
- DR with more than NPDR ,
- Diabetic macular oedema,
- media opacities such as corneal or lens opacities that could preclude appropriate OCT imaging,
- presence of other retinal diseases such as Age-related macular degeneration, Vitreo-macular traction, Macular hole, Epiretinal membrane, Retinal vein occlusion, Macular scars,
- Glaucoma, Optic neuropathies or Neurodegenerative diseases,
- history of ocular trauma,
- Refractive errors of more than Â±6 diopters (spherical equivalent),
- previous ocular surgery, focal laser, panretinal photocoagulation or anti-VEGF intravitreal injection
